definitions: If you extinguish a fire or a light, you stop it burning or shining.
If something extinguishes a feeling or idea, it destroys it.
to put out or quench (a light, flames, etc)
to remove or destroy entirely; annihilate
to eclipse or obscure by or as if by superior brilliance
to put out (a fire, etc.); quench; smother
to put an end to; destroy or cause to die out
to put in the shade; eclipse; obscure
to put out (a fire, light, etc.); put out the flame of (something burning or lighted)
to put an end to or bring to an end; wipe out of existence; annihilate
to obscure or eclipse, as by superior brilliance
to discharge (a debt), as by payment
